citation.article-title: Schineria larvae gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from the 1st and 2nd larval stages of Wohlfahrtia magnifica (Diptera: Sarcophagidae).
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Schineria larvae sp. nov.
Schineria larvae (lar'vae. L. gen. fem. larvae pertaining to the origin of the type strain isolated from Wohlfahrtia magni®ca maggots)
Cells are straight, short, single rods (2-3 μm x 0.8-0.9 μm), non-motile and encapsulated, occurring singly at all ages.
On agar media colonies are nonpigmented, small (1-3 mm in diameter), circular with entire margin and smooth surface.
Strictly aerobic, NO-3 not reduced.
Optimum growth occurs between pH 6 and 10.
Temperature range is wide (4-45 °C), optimum growth at 28-37 °C.
Catalase-positive, oxidase-variable.
Urea and chitin are hydrolysed.
Indole, casein and gelatin are not metabolized.
H2S is produced from cysteine.
Simmon's citrate, Voges-Proskauer and aesculin digestion are negative.
Not haemolytic.

Uses monomethylsuccinate, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, succinic acid, L-asparagine, L-glutamic acid, glycyl-L-glutamic acid, L-histidine, L-leucine, L-phenylalanine, L-pyroglutamic acid and γ-aminobutyric acid as sole carbon source.

No utilization of acyclodextrin, glycogen, D-arabitol, cellobiose, i-erythritol, gentiobiose, α-lactose, α-D-lactose-lactulose, xylitol, D-galacturonic acid lactone, D-glucosaminic acid, α-ketovaleric acid, propionic acid, quinic acid, dsaccharic acid, sebaic acid, L-threonine, DL-carnitine, phenylethylamine, putrescine, 2-aminoethanol and 2,3-butanediol.
No acid production from carbohydrates in API CH50.
The major isoprenoid quinone is Q-8.
The major fatty acids are C18:1, C16:0 and C14:0.
Cyclo-C18:0 also occurs.
Predominant polar lipids are PG, PE and PS.
G­C content of DNA is 42 mol%.
Isolated from the L1 and L2 stage larvae of an obligate parasitic fly, Wohlfahrtia magnifica.
Type strain is L1/68T (=DSM 13226T=NCAIM B01938T).
